channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How To Prevent Grandma, Grandpa–And Yourself–From Getting Ripped Off Online
item.description: Online financial fraud is growing fast, while crypto and speedy money transfers are making it tougher to recover stolen funds. Here are tips for staying safe.

item.title: In defense of the hard parts
item.description: Yesterday’s post was a little glib. Without a doubt, we add more value when we focus on the emotional labor of important work, leaving others the chance to create commodities. But the repetitive, difficult nature of leaning into commodity production can give us insight, humility and skill. It helps us understand just how hard the […]

item.title: Microsoft Issues Mandatory 2FA Login Deadline Alert
item.description: Microsoft has confirmed that as part of a $20 billion secure future initiative, mandatory Azure multi-factor authentication logins will start rolling out on October 15.

item.title: The hard parts (and the important parts)
item.description: The hard parts of what you do all day can feel fraught. It’s heavy lifting. Emergencies. Dangerous labor. The stakes are high and the work can be difficult. The important parts of what you do all day are valuable to someone else. This is what you’re getting paid for–solving a customer’s problems. A simple example: […]

item.title: Microsoft’s New Upgrade Decision—Bad News Confirmed For 70% Of All Windows Users
item.description: Microsoft’s surprise move is a huge warning for hundreds of millions of Windows users.

item.title: The paradox of lottery thinking
item.description: Tim Brownson points us to this recent poll of people in Great Britain. About one out of four people surveyed (of all ages) believe that they could qualify for the Olympics if they trained for the next four years. This is absurd. It’s the very absurdity of it that makes it common. “I could do […]

item.title: Back-To-School Essentials For K-12 Teachers Exploring AI
item.description: Discover 5 practical steps for educators learning AI at the start of the new school year. Start small, follow policies, build trust and collaborate effectively.

item.title: Long-term selfish
item.description: Everyone is selfish. We do things that increase our chances of survival, help us achieve our goals and give us a story we can tell ourselves about our role in the community. But short-term selfish is something we try to grow out of. Short-term selfish runs a red light because we’re in a hurry. It […]

item.title: NASA’s New Chief Artificial Intelligence Officer Is A Man On A Mission
item.description: NASA's new AI officer aims to advance AI in space exploration and climate modeling, setting an example for responsible use of the technology across the U.S. government.

item.title: Multiple choice
item.description: “None of the above” is often the best option. We’re regularly confronted with multiple-choice questions. The foundation is already established, the options are already limited, do you want this or that? But the real questions lie in the assumptions that happened before you were even asked. When a developer brings you six website options, they’re […]
